short_summary: The Canadian Border Services Agency has a requirement for the purchase, delivery and installation of office seating to Moncton, New-Brunswick by April 15th, 2024.
description: This procurement is set aside under the federal government’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business. The procurement is set aside from the international trade agreements under the provision each has for set-asides for small and minority businesses. There is no security associated with the requirement. Only suppliers who are pre-qualified and have been issued a supply arrangement are eligible to bid. Non-Supply Arrangement (Non-SA) holders may submit a bid to the Identified User (IU) but must also submit an arrangement to the Supply Arrangement Authority (SAA) for evaluation.
duration_in_months: cPortal to be informed by end user with evaluation period based on required specifications. Final Completion date of estimated 3-6 months duration from it’s start.
full_summary:
# Tender Information

## Project Title
* Office Seating, CBSA, Moncton NB (Amendment 1)

## Reference and Solicitation Information
* Reference Number: WS4378104535-Doc4407007868
* Solicitation Number: WS4378104535

## Tender Details
* Publication Date: January 23, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: February 9, 2024, 2:00 PM EST
* Amendment Date: February 5, 2024

## Contract Details
* Expected Contract Start Date: February 9, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: Ongoing

## Tender Location and Delivery
* The tender is open to suppliers based in New Brunswick, Canada.
* The office seating will be required for the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) at the Canadian Border Services Agency in Moncton, New Brunswick.

## Notice and Description
* This National Public Procurement (NPP) is issued in accordance with Public Works and Government Services (PWGSC) Supply Arrangement (SA) # E60PQ-120001/H.
* The NPP covers the requirement for rotary chairs, which is part of the Product Sub-Category 1 under the SA.
* The Canadian Border Services Agency (CBSA) has a requirement for the purchase, delivery, and installation of office seating to Moncton, New Brunswick by April 15th, 2024.
* This procurement is set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business and is excluded from international trade agreements.
* Only suppliers who are Pre-qualified and have been issued a Supply Arrangement (SA) are eligible to bid.

## Evaluation and Selection Criteria
* The selection criteria for this tender are based on Lowest Price.

## Procurement Method
* This procurement will be conducted through a Selective Tendering method.

## Contact Information
* For more information, please contact Kristelle Leblanc (SPAC/PSPC) at kristelle.leblanc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. You may also reach out to RCNAmeublement.NCRFurniture@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca if you wish to become a pre-qualified SA holder.
